keyEvents.title: Crew Returns to Thousand Sunny
keyEvents.description: Robin, Franky, Usopp, and Chopper return to the ship and find Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji have returned but lost their shadows.
keyEvents.significance: The ship serves as the reunion point where critical information is exchanged and the connection between Brook and Laboon is revealed.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of Shadow Loss
keyEvents.description: The crew discovers the ship has been ransacked and three of their members have lost their shadows.
keyEvents.significance: This reveals the consequences of the crew's separate adventures on Thriller Bark.

keyEvents.title: Brook's Promise to Laboon Revealed
keyEvents.description: Aboard the Thousand Sunny, Franky shares Brook's backstory about his promise to return to Laboon.
keyEvents.significance: The ship becomes the setting for one of the most emotionally significant revelations in the Thriller Bark arc.

historicalSignificance: The second ship of the Straw Hat Pirates, built by Franky using Adam Wood. Serves as their home and base of operations.

keyEvents.title: Laboon's Location Revealed
keyEvents.description: It is revealed that Laboon waits at Reverse Mountain (Twin Cape) for Brook and the Rumbar Pirates to return.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Reverse Mountain as the destination Brook must eventually reach to fulfill his promise.

keyEvents.title: Flashback to Meeting Laboon
keyEvents.description: The episode includes flashback footage of the Straw Hats meeting Laboon at Reverse Mountain.
keyEvents.significance: Reminds viewers of the crew's connection to this location and their own promise to Laboon.

historicalSignificance: The entrance to the Grand Line where all pirates from the four seas must pass through. Also known as Twin Cape.
culturalSignificance: The location where the Rumbar Pirates left Laboon with a promise to return, and where the Straw Hats first entered the Grand Line and met Laboon.
